business.headline: Infosys, HCLTech, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?Infosys, HCLTech, and TCS stocks rallied today on the BSE and NSE, driven by India–US trade optimism, Infosys' record buyback, strong Q2 earnings expectations, and renewed investor confidence.

ITR refund still pending? Check your status online and know the reasons for delayWhile many taxpayers have already received their refunds, a few are still waiting for the amount to reach their bank accounts. If you haven't received yours yet, here's how you can track your refund online and find out what might be causing the delay.

Sensex, Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs: Will festive rally continue on Dalal Street?Sensex and Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs, fueled by festive optimism, trade deal hopes, and strong domestic and FII inflows. Key sectors like IT, pharma, and textiles are leading gains.

Gold, silver prices crash: Why are the precious metals under pressure?Gold and silver metals, which hit record highs earlier, have started to decline as investors book profits and shift back to assets such as equities.

Infosys shares rise over 4% today: What's driving the rally?Infosys shares jumped 3.2% to Rs 1,519.75 after announcing a record Rs 18,000 crore buyback. Promoters abstaining boosted investor sentiment, driving IT stock gains and strong market interest today.

Markets heading towards all-time high: Where should you invest now?After weeks of steady growth, benchmark indices are now showing signs of reaching fresh all-time highs, with investors looking for the next big opportunity.

Sensex jumps 800 points: Why is the stock market rising today?Markets rally as Sensex and Nifty climb on trade deal optimism. IT, pharma, textiles lead gains. Will the festive momentum sustain or face volatility? Traders remain watchful.

Sensex, Nifty rise further as reports hint at positive India–US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 571.48 points to 84,997.82 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading above 26,000. Broader market sentiment also remained upbeat, supported by steady global cues and sustained domestic optimism.

Will Sensex, Nifty touch record highs today amid festive momentum?India's retail industry recorded its biggest-ever festive season sales this year, with Diwali business touching Rs 5.40 lakh crore in goods and Rs 65,000 crore in services.
Will gold and silver prices fall more today after the recent crash?Gold had fallen the most in over a decade on Tuesday, while silver recorded its steepest one-day decline since February 2021.

Compliance norms for edible oil industry tightened, nationwide inspections plannedStakeholders have been urged to complete registration and begin monthly reporting without delay to support a robust, data driven edible oil supply chain.

Criminal angle in Kalyani family feud as police begin inquiry into property fraudIndustrialist Gaurishankar Kalyani and his wife are to be summoned by police for an inquiry into the illegal transfer of ancestral properties by cheating and duping sister Sugandha Hiremath.

Samvat 2082: Top stocks and sectors to bet on for the new yearIndia's macroeconomic fundamentals remain firm. Global rating agency S&P recently upgraded India's credit outlook, while the International Monetary Fund (IMF) raised its GDP forecast.

Curious case of RRP Semiconductor: The stock that gained 63,000% in 18 monthsRRP Semiconductor's stock soared from Rs 15 to Rs 9,478 in just 18 months, stunning Dalal Street. But do the company's financials really justify this meteoric rise?

Waaree Energies shares jump 50% in a year: More upside left in the stock?The company's Q2 FY26 results were strong across all key metrics. Waaree Energies reported a 132.97% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 871.21 crore in the September 2025 quarter, compared to Rs 375.66 crore a year ago.

Will gold, silver prices fall in India tomorrow as global rates crash?Global gold and silver have cooled after historic gains, while MCX remains closed. Will Indian investors face similar declines tomorrow, or is this a buying opportunity? Read on to find out.

US likely to cut tariffs on Indian imports to 15%-16%: ReportThe proposed agreement mainly focusses on the energy and agriculture sectors. One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.

Samvat 2082: 15 high-conviction stock ideas amid ongoing market rallyAnalysts see higher returns ahead as Dalal Street enters Samvat 2082. Check out Choice Broking's top 15 stock picks span defence, tech, and premium consumption.

BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?The stock market was closed on Tuesday on account of Diwali and only two more holidays remain this year. One for Guru Nanank Jayanti on November 05 and the other for Christmas, December 25.

Gold, silver prices fall: Is the bullion rally ending?Gold prices have gained nearly 56% this year due to strong demand from central banks, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and rising expectations of rate cuts by major central banks.

entertainment.headline: Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office: Rs 16.5 crore in 2 days despite Thamma clash Actor Harshvardhan Rane and Sonam Bajwa's film 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' collected Rs 16.5 crore in India in two days. The movie is facing strong competition from 'Thamma'.

Bigg Boss 19: Neelam ends friendship with Tanya for being two-faced Neelam Giri accuses Tanya Mittal of being two-faced on 'Bigg Boss 19'. The confrontation sparks heated debates and shifting alliances inside the house.

Is Blackpink's Lisa gearing up for a 2026 solo tour? Signs point yes Lisa, BLACKPINK member, has signed with Wasserman Music for global touring representation. The move comes amid ongoing group and solo activities, including music and acting projects.

Amitabh Bachchan recalls how Dr Rajkumar prayed for his life after Coolie accident Amitabh Bachchan recalled how Kannada legend Dr Rajkumar performed a sacred ritual praying for his recovery after the near-fatal 'Coolie' accident in 1982. The actor fondly remembered their lasting bond and praised Rajkumar's humility despite his god-like stature in Karnataka.

Sara Ali Khan visits Kedarnath temple, opens up about her deep connection. Pics Sara Ali Khan revisited Kedarnath, sharing heartfelt gratitude for the blessings and expressing her deep spiritual connection on Instagram.

Jon Bon Jovi gears up for 2026 tour: Fought back for fans after vocal cord surgery Rock band Bon Jovi returns to the stage in 2026 following Jon Bon Jovi's challenging recovery from vocal cord surgery, with new tour dates and renewed focus on performance quality.

Ken Casey defends Bad Bunny's Super Bowl role, calls Trump's remarks ridiculous Ken Casey of Dropkick Murphys has defended Bad Bunny's role as the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show performer amid criticism. Former President Donald Trump labelled the selection as "absolutely ridiculous", sparking debate.

Physical infidelity not a dealbreaker for Twinkle, KJo, Kajol; Janhvi disagrees The recent episode of 'Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle' sparked a lively debate on fidelity, highlighting generational differences in attitudes towards physical and emotional infidelity. While Khanna and others suggested physical infidelity can be overlooked, Janhvi Kapoor disagreed.

Sushmita Sen believed Miss India 1994 was rigged, recalls filmmaker Prahlad Kakkar Ad filmmaker Prahlad Kakkar revealed that Sushmita Sen once broke down during the 1994 Miss India pageant, believing the contest was rigged in favour of Aishwarya Rai. He shared how Sushmita's confidence in the final round ultimately secured her the crown, marking the start of her iconic journey.

Subhash Ghai on Ranbir Kapoor: He's more mature now, Rishi would've been proud Veteran filmmaker Subhash Ghai reflected on Ranbir Kapoor's evolution from a rebellious youngster to a mature actor and husband, crediting his late father Rishi Kapoor and wife Alia Bhatt for the change. He added that success in cinema comes from talent and hard work, not nepotism.

The textbook of love: The resurgence of college romances in Telugu cinema Telugu cinema is reviving the charm of college romances with fresh, feel-good stories like 'Little Hearts' and 'K-Ramp', bringing back the warmth and nostalgia of campus love amidst a wave of action-heavy releases.

Vijay's fans incorrectly describe him as Chief Minister of India to YouTuber Speed Fans shouted 'TVK' and Thalapathy Vijay at American YouTuber Speed during a live stream in Thailand. The incident drew online reactions, especially after Vijay was incorrectly described as 'Chief Minister of India.'

Bhojpuri comedy show inspired by Kapil Sharma goes viral. All you need to know Bihar's 'The JP Yadavv Showw' is a comedy series inspired by 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. The show's local humour and Bhojpuri flavour are winning digital audiences across the region.

Janhvi Kapoor breaks silence on surgery rumours, recalls mother Sridevi's lessons Janhvi Kapoor addressed cosmetic surgery rumours, crediting her late mother Sridevi for guiding her choices. Urging transparency and self-acceptance amid social media pressures, she dismissed bizarre online claims and advocated open, stigma-free conversations around beauty.

Hina Khan questions Bigg Boss 19 nominations, sparks transparency debatev During the latest 'Bigg Boss 19' nomination, Hina Khan publicly criticised the process, suggesting it was manipulated. Her comments raise concerns among viewers about fairness in the nomination system.

Priyanka Chopra unwinds by the beach with Nick, Malti, and mother Madhu. Pics out Priyanka Chopra Jonas enjoyed a peaceful beach getaway with Nick Jonas, daughter Malti, and her mother Madhu after the Diwali festivities. The actor shared heartwarming moments from their family time, giving fans a glimpse of her relaxed post-celebration mood.

Mammootty, Vinayak's Kalamkaval gets UA certificate, release date to be announced Mammootty's upcoming film 'Kalamkaval' has been certified U/A 16+ by the CBFC. The release date is expected soon, marking the actor's return after a health break.

Happy birthday Prabhas: Rebel Star who redefined pan-India superstardom From 'Baahubali' to 'The Raja Saab', Prabhas has never played it safe. As he turns 45, we look at how the Telugu superstar continues to reinvent himself, trusting new filmmakers, exploring new genres, and quietly redefining what it means to be a Pan-India hero.

Kim Kardashian celebrates 45th birthday in Paris with cast of legal drama All's Fair Kim Kardashian marked her 45th birthday in Paris alongside her All's Fair co-stars, enjoying an extravagant party, couture fashion moments, and family surprises.

general news.headline: Live: Key Mahagathbandhan briefing begins, Tejashwi Yadav likely to be made CM-faceBihar Election News Live Updates: The opposition Mahagathbandhan alliance in Bihar has reached a consensus on Tejashwi Yadav as its Chief Ministerial candidate. Today, the alliance's constituent parties are set to endorse his leadership, with the official announcement of his candidature. Under Tejashwi's leadership, the alliance plans to campaign with the slogan, "Chalo Bihar... Badle Bihar." Of the 243 seats in the assembly, the RJD and Congress are contesting 143 and 61, respectively, but both parties are headed for a "friendly fight" in at least five constituencies. Follow indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

PM Modi's latest post pours cold water on possible meeting with TrumpPM Modi's decision to attend the ASEAN summit virtually means he is unlikely to have another opportunity to meet Donald Trump this year. The Prime Minister has been a regular feature at the annual summit.

Virat Kohli bags back-to-back ducks, waves goodbye to fans at Adelaide OvalAustralia vs India, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli's much-awaited Adelaide swansong ended in disappointment as the former captain was dismissed LBW for 0, registering back-to-back ducks in the three-match series.

2nd ODI Live: Hazlewood exceptional spell ends without a wicketIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 2nd ODI Live Score: India have lost wickets of Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul in quick succession. Adam Zampa, playing the first match of the series, helped Australia control the middle overs. Axar Patel and Washington Sundar are currently in the crease as India continue to struggle in Adelaide.

Breathless on Diwali: Banning crackers isn't 'anti-Hindu', polluted air isSo who does one hold accountable for the national capital being amongst the most polluted cities in the world where in Diwali week the air quality routinely takes a turn for the worse and only aggravates chronic respiratory illnesses?

Watch: Rohit Sharma urges Virat Kohli to walk off after 2nd straight duck vs AUSAUS vs IND: Virat Kohli was dismissed for his second consecutive duck in India's second ODI against Australia in Adelaide. Rohit Sharma advised him to walk off and not opt for a review.

While many die for US citizenship, why are some giving up theirs?While millions strive for US citizenship, many Americans abroad are renouncing it. A 2025 survey shows 49% of expats considering renunciation, with 51% citing political frustration. In Canada, US immigration enquiries surged 300% after the presidential election. Why are people giving up their American citizenship?

Gold, silver prices crash: Why are the precious metals under pressure?Gold and silver metals, which hit record highs earlier, have started to decline as investors book profits and shift back to assets such as equities.

From Golconda to Louvre: Journey of the 'cursed' diamond left behind in the heistFrom a mine in southern India to the crown of France, the Regent Diamond's story spans empires, betrayals, and revolutions. Once hidden in a wound, smuggled in a shoe, and set in the sword of Napoleon, the gem remains a reminder of how power and desire have long been shaped by the glitter of a single stone.

No respect: BJP mocks Congress as Rahul Gandhi absent from Mahagathbandhan posterThe poster for the Mahagathbandhan press conference, which is scheduled for 11 am today, shows Tejashwi Yadav in the centre, with smaller images of other alliance partners, but no trace of Rahul Gandhi.

55-year-old Kerala nun jumps hurdles in religious attire, wins state-level goldA 55-year-old nun, Sister Sabina from Wayanad, won gold in hurdles at the State Masters' Athletics meet while competing in her religious attire. Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty lauded her inspiring feat.

4 most-wanted gangsters of Bihar's Sigma Gang killed in Delhi encounter with copsFour wanted gangsters from Bihar, including notorious criminal Ranjan Pathak, were killed in a joint Delhi-Bihar Police encounter in Rohini.

Physical infidelity not a dealbreaker for Twinkle, KJo, Kajol; Janhvi disagreesThe recent episode of 'Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle' sparked a lively debate on fidelity, highlighting generational differences in attitudes towards physical and emotional infidelity. While Khanna and others suggested physical infidelity can be overlooked, Janhvi Kapoor disagreed.

Ram Charan's wife Upasana shares festive post, sparks rumours of second pregnancyRam Charan's wife, Upasana Kamineni Konidela, sparked speculation about the couple expecting their second child with a festive social media post. Captioned "double the love, double the happiness," the video appeared to celebrate a possible pregnancy, delighting fans and followers.

Odisha boy films Instagram reel close to track, dies after being hit by trainA teenage boy from Odisha died after being hit by a speeding train while filming an Instagram reel close to the railway tracks in Puri district.

I am a doctor and here's what I know about sudden deaths from silent heart killersAortic aneurysms and dissections are silent killers often mistaken for heart attacks. Early screening and awareness can prevent sudden deaths in India.

Comedian's heartwarming post for Air India air hostess has Internet looking for PreetiComedian Aditi Mittal shared a heartwarming story about an Air India flight attendant named Preeti who comforted her during one of the toughest moments of her life.

Pierre Poilievre's Diwali wish lights up controversy over Khalistani panderingCanadian Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre's Diwali greeting, meant to celebrate both Bandi Chhor Divas and Diwali, was immediately pounced upon by critics who claimed Poilievre's phrasing blurred religious lines and echoed separatist talking points.

Man dressed as Shivaji clashes with guard over language dispute in MaharashtraThe man was stopped by a security guard, Brijesh Kumar Gupta, who was on duty at the fort. The man questioned Gupta about not learning Marathi despite working in Maharashtra for two years.

Why tattoos are the new travel souvenirsPeople are now travelling across the world just to get inked; after all, a tattoo made far from home is a reminder that you belong wherever your story takes you.

The textbook of love: The resurgence of college romances in Telugu cinemaTelugu cinema is reviving the charm of college romances with fresh, feel-good stories like 'Little Hearts' and 'K-Ramp', bringing back the warmth and nostalgia of campus love amidst a wave of action-heavy releases.

BrahMos missile engineer, 30, dies in Lucknow, heart attack suspectedAkashdeep Gupta, a Brahmos missile system engineer with DRDO in Lucknow, died on Tuesday night after a sudden health decline. Police suspect a heart attack but await the post-mortem report for confirmation.

Elon Musk brawls with Trump's Nasa chief over space agency's futureThe exchange has come amid broader speculation that the Trump administration is considering bringing Nasa under the Department of Transportation.

Patna-bound SpiceJet flight returns to Delhi after suspected technical snagThe Boeing 737-8A aircraft has been grounded for a detailed inspection, and checks are currently underway. An alternate flight is being arranged for the affected passengers.

sports.headline: Babar Azam returns to Pakistan T20I squad before World Cup; Rizwan still sidelined Pakistan recalled Babar Azam to T20Is, four months before next year's T20 World Cup. However, wicketkeeper-batter Mohammad Rizwan remains sidelined from the T20I squad. Pakistan play a T20I series against South Africa and a tri-series against Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe in October-November.

Watch: Rohit Sharma urges Virat Kohli to walk off after 2nd straight duck vs AUS AUS vs IND: Virat Kohli was dismissed for his second consecutive duck in India's second ODI against Australia in Adelaide. Rohit Sharma advised him to walk off and not opt for a review.

Under-fire India, aiming to revive campaign against feisty New Zealand India women face New Zealand in a must-win Women's World Cup encounter in Navi Mumbai. The outcome will decide their semi-final fate amid challenging weather and team form.

Virat Kohli bags back-to-back ducks, waves goodbye to fans at Adelaide Oval Australia vs India, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli's much-awaited Adelaide swansong ended in disappointment as the former captain was dismissed LBW for 0, registering back-to-back ducks in the three-match series.

Fans bash Gambhir again after Kuldeep Yadav snubbed from 2nd ODI AUS vs IND: Kuldeep Yadav was once again left out of India's playing XI for the second ODI against Australia in Adelaide, reigniting criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill.

Golden Arm Gets New Stripes: Neeraj Chopra Now An Honorary Lieutenant Colonel In Indian Army This special report covers Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra being conferred the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Indian Army. The ceremony, held in New Delhi, was attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Chief of Army Staff General Upendra Dwivedi. On receiving the honour, Chopra stated, 'This is more than an honour - it is a responsibility towards my country'. The recognition celebrates his exceptional achievements in athletics and his role as an inspiration to the youth. Chopra, who joined the army as a Naib Subedar on August 26, 2016, has been lauded as an icon of perseverance and national pride. This places him in a select group of Indian sports figures, including Abhinav Bindra and MS Dhoni, to receive such an honorary rank in the armed forces.

UCL: Liverpool and Chelsea relish goal-fest, Real Madrid edge Juventus Liverpool and Chelsea returned to winning ways with emphatic 5-1 victories, while Real Madrid continued their perfect Champions League run with a narrow 1-0 win over Juventus.

Women's World Cup: Harleen, Pratika, and India coach's confusing lack of clarity India women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar has dismissed strike rotation concerns ahead of the upcoming fixture against New Zealand in the Women's World Cup 2025. Muzumdar was seen contradicting his viewpoint from earlier in the tournament.

Adam Zampa, playing the first match of the series, helped Australia control the middle overs. Axar Patel and Washington Sundar are currently in the crease as India continue to struggle in Adelaide.

Can Harmanpreet Kaur help India break the SENA jinx in New Zealand clash?India haven't won a Women's World Cup match against a SENA nation since Harmanpreet Kaur's iconic 171 against Australia. They'll have a chance to end that streak when they face New Zealand in Navi Mumbai on Thursday.

McGrath applauds world-class Sutherland, Gardner's rescue act against EnglandStand-in captain Tahlia McGrath lauds Sutherland and Gardner's world-class batting in a six-wicket win over England. Their unbeaten 180-run partnership showcased Australia's resilience and depth in the Women's World Cup.

Ashwin explains how Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli can rediscover ODI formAustralia vs India: Former India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin reckons that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli need support, space, open communication, and the right environment to rediscover their best form in ODIs.

French Open: Satwik-Chirag knocked out of men's doubles; Unnati Hooda progressesFrench Open: Chirag Shetty and Satwiksairaj Rankireddy were knocked out of the Super 750 badminton tournament after losing their round of 32 match to Indonesia's Rahmat Hidayat and Muhammad Rian Ardianto on Wednesday. However, rising star Unnati Hooda kept Indian hopes alive by advancing to the pre-quarter-finals.

New Zealand will wear the underdog badge with pride against India: Sophie DevineNew Zealand's Sophie Devine admits that India will come into their upcoming fixture as the favourites. The two sides are set to clash in what will be a virtual quarterfinal clash, with the final ticket to the semis up for grabs.

After Sarfaraz Khan's shock omission, Irfan Pathan urges fans to trust selectorsIrfan Pathan appeals to fans to trust the BCCI selectors despite Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion. The debate raises questions on selection transparency and procedural issues.

IND vs NZ, Navi Mumbai weather forecast: Will rain disrupt crucial clash?Women's World Cup: India will look to end their three-match losing streak when they face New Zealand in Navi Mumbai, in a contest threatened by rain, with forecasts predicting "rain or thundershowers" later in the evening or night.

Will BCCI push for Mohsin Naqvi to be impeached as ACC chairman?The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) reportedly have majority support but are unlikely to push for the impeachment of Asian Cricket Council (ACC) chief Mohsin Naqvi, aiming to avoid further tensions with Pakistan ahead of India hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.

Can Virat Kohli rekindle the magic in one last dance at Adelaide Oval?Australia vs India, 2nd ODI: Adelaide has celebrated Kohli's triumphs, but the story isn't over. One last innings at his beloved Oval could be the statement that confirms the hunger still burns, with the 2027 World Cup the prize he's aiming to conquer.

Dominant Australia extend unbeaten run as Sutherland, Gardner decimate EnglandWomen's World Cup: Ashleigh Gardner smashed a record 69-ball century, while Annabel Sutherland remained unbeaten on 98, as tournament favourites and defending champions Australia crushed England by six wickets in their clash on Wednesday.

Al-Nassr down brave FC Goa 2-1 in thrilling Fatorda showdownFC Goa fought valiantly at Fatorda Stadium but fell short as Al-Nassr secured a hard-fought win. Angelo Gabriel and Haroune Camara scored early for the visitors, while Brison Fernandes pulled one back. Late red card for David Timor ended Goa's comeback hopes.

Ashes: Australia legend says Steve Smith shouldn't captain in Cummins' absenceGreg Chappell said that Australia shouldn't have made Steve Smith the captain for the first Ashes Test against England. Smith will step in to fill for Pat Cummins as the pacer continues to recover from a back injury.

Feel sorry for Sarfaraz: Ashwin slams young batter's exclusion from India A squadFormer India spinner R Ashwin has expressed concern over Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion following the announcement of the India A squads for the red-ball series against South Africa A. Ashwin highlighted Sarfaraz's strong domestic performances and recent fitness improvements.

IND vs NZ Predicted XI: Will India bring back Jemimah Rodrigues?Women's World Cup, IND vs NZ: Jemimah Rodrigues didn't play the match against England, but India can think of bringing her back in the match against the White Ferns in Navi Mumbai.

Devine sees India as favourites despite home pressure in crucial semifinal clashNew Zealand's Sophie Devine sees India as the clear favourites ahead of their clash which is a virtual quarterfinal clash as both sides compete for the last remaining spot for the next stage of the Women's World Cup.

Abhinav Bindra to be a torch-bearer for next 2026 Winter OlympicsOlympic gold medallist Abhinav Bindra was selected as a torch-bearer for next year's Winter Games. The Winter Olympics 2026 will be held from February 6 to February 22 in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
